newsitem.title: TURKEY: TURKISH MINISTER SAYS ILLEGAL ISLAM COURSES TO GO.
newsitem.headline: TURKISH MINISTER SAYS ILLEGAL ISLAM COURSES TO GO.

text.p: Turkey's interior minister vowed on Saturday to close down thousands of outlawed Islamic education centres in a military-inspired crackdown against religious activism, Anatolian news agency said.
"Not one illegal Koranic course, religious hostel or similar institution will remain," the agency quoted minister Meral Aksener as saying.
"We will take all the necessary precautions to prevent our country's bright horizon from darkening," said Aksener, from the secularist wing of Prime Minister Necmettin Erbakan's coalition government.

The secularist army has demanded that the government curtail growing Islamist sentiment in what it says is a matter of life or death for Turkey. But Erbakan's Islam-based Welfare Party has stalled on implementing the crackdown.
Aksener said the dozens of underground Koranic classes closed by police in recent raids represented less than two percent of the number of illegal courses.
